title: Bake Shops
name: Bake Shops
description:
A Map by Baostar

Bakeries around the neighborhood.

properties.name: Balboa Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar301 Main, Newport Beach, CA 92661

properties.name: C'est Si Bon Bakery & Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  3444 E Coast Highway, Corona Del Mar, CA 92625

properties.name: C'est la Vie
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 373 South Coast Hwy., Laguna Beach, CA 92651Enjoy sumptuous French cuisine in the comfortable yet elegant dining room of C\'est Le Vie, located off of Main Beach Laguna. Select from extensive menu that features the finest representation of French specialties like veal loin spiced with green peppercorn and filet mignon in a creamy mustard sauce.

properties.name: Campitelli Cookies
properties.description: Posted by Baostar924 E Imperial Hwy, Brea, CA 92821This small bakery features a gallery of fresh-baked cookies and various packaging should you want to present a batch as a gift. The cookies, a secret family recipe, are thick, plump and generous in size. Take your pick: sugar, chocolate chip, double chocolate chip, candy-filled…the list goes on and on. The misfit cookies have aesthetic defects, but they taste just the same as their more appealing counterparts and sell for half-price. Campitelli also offers a selection of sandwiches, stromboli, and fabulous pepperoni rolls served with marinara sauce for dipping.

properties.name: Champagne Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  3901 Irvine Blvd., Irvine, CA 92603A nice spot to sit and read the newspaper on a Sunday morning.

properties.name: French's Cupcake Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar273 E. 17th Street, Costa Mesa, CA 92627Family owned and operated by Jerry and Dianne French. They offer a mind-boggling range of cakes, and most of their cakes are one of a kind. We got birthday cakes from them from the past and they were simply delicious!

properties.name: French's Pastry
properties.description: Posted by Baostar14443 Culver Dr, Irvine, CA

properties.name: Frosted Cupcakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar195 Claremont Ave, Long Beach, CA 90803Joining the ranks of other cupcake boutiques is the Frosted Cupcakery in Belmont Shore.

properties.name: Haute Cakes Caffe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 1807 Westcliff Drive, Newport Beach, CA 92660Tucked among children\'s boutiques and salons, Haute Cakes Caffe has earned a reputation for great pancakes. They serves up three large golden buttermilk cakes with butter and maple syrup on the side. And for a long time, only the plain (albeit delicious) cakes were available. Country French bakery bread is browned and spread with creamy mascarpone cheese; it\'s then dotted with fresh raspberries and drizzled with honey to create a sort of deconstructed toast and jam. Their favorite salad combines romaine with crumbled Maytag blue cheese, thinly sliced apples and candied pecans in a champagne vinaigrette.

properties.name: Heidelberg Pastry Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 1100 S Coast Hwy, Laguna Beach 92651The Heidelberg is a casual place located right on Pacific Coast Highway. There are some indoor seats and a few outdoor tables on a patio just above the street. You will get traffic noise here, but it\'s also the perfect people-watching locale. It\'s a local favorite and packed all the time, especially for breakfast.

properties.name: Herb's Blackforest Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar18225 Brookhurst Ave., Fountain Valley, CA 92708I grew up on the puffs pastries and florentines cookies here.

properties.name: JJ Bakery & Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 15333 Culver Dr, Irvine, CA 92604I come here for the Sun cakes...I love Sun cake...Sun cakes are flaky, layer-pastries with sugar paste in the center. I eat them like cookies - but at a piece, they\'re not so cost effective.

properties.name: Julian's Pie Company
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 2225 Main St., Julian, CA 92036 You can get apple pie (and several other kinds) here all year round, but in October, this place is a madhouse. The line stretches out the door of the little house practically from the minute they open until the pies are all gone. And let this be a warning: sometimes the pies are gone before closing. Get there before 5 p.m. if you want to take something home. On the off-season, pies are made with Washington apples. During the fall harvest, all available local apples go into the pies too. There are several tables inside the restaurant and a few outside, and all are in high demand. With your warm slice, ask for vanilla or cinnamon ice cream, cheddar cheese or whipped cream. There is also good coffee and hot chocolate for sale - just the thing ward off that seasonal nip in the air. - SignOn San Diego

properties.name: La Brea Bakery Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  1556 S Disneyland Dr, Anaheim, CA 92802Only the second location to be opened by the owners of La Brea Bakery in Los Angeles, the SoCal eatery adds aromas of fresh-baked goodness to Downtown Disney. There are two parts to La Brea Bakery Cafe, the express side (which is basically a walk-through cafeteria with breakfast items, sandwiches, fresh juices and oodles of breads) and the cafe (which has a sit-down area for lunch and dinner only). Here you\'ll get country fare and a nice Caesar salad, salmon, ahi, pasta and focaccia sandwiches. Kids choose from their own menu featuring such items as peanut-butter-and-jelly sandwiches or little pastas. Beer and wine are available.

properties.name: La Creperie Café
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 5110 E. Second St., Long Beach, CAThis Provencal-inspired cafe offers perfection drenched in butter and sugar with a twist of lemon. The best crepes in town!

properties.name: Pacific Whey Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  This european-inspired cafe serves breakfast with the highest quality and freshest ingredients, and they make their food from scratch, which is exactly how I like it.

properties.name: Panera Bread
properties.description: Posted by Baobot3988 Barranca Pkwy., Irvine, CA, United StatesFresh baked muffins, focaccio, pastries and much more. The soup in a bread bowl is quite popular. Plenty of seating inside and out, the atmosphere is reminiscent of a French cafe and lounge music plays soothingly. Wi-Fi is free.

properties.name: Plum's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  369 E 17th, Costa Mesa, CA 92627A trendy breakfast place in the corner of a non-descript shopping mall. A local secret that is not so secret anymore - they\'re always a line here. The Dutch Babies and coconut french toasts are my favorites.

properties.name: Sprinkles Cupcakes
properties.description: Posted by Baostar944 Avocado Ave., Newport Beach, CASprinkles Cupcakes finally opened at Corona Del Mar Plaza. It\'s party time!

properties.name: Viktor Bene's Continental Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar5521 Alton Pkwy., Irvine, CA 92602A nice bakery inside Gelson\'s Market with a large selection of breads, pastries, tarts, cookies and cakes. They usually have free samples for you to taste.

properties.name: Village Bakery
properties.description: Posted by System2937 Bristol St, Costa Mesa, CAVillage Bakery (714) 751-2220

properties.name: Wonderland Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar1314 Bison, Newport Beach, CAA new and enchanted bakery that opened across from The Bluffs in Newport Beach.

properties.name: Zov's Bistro & Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 17440 E 17th St. Tustin, CA 92780This Armenian-Meets-Middle-Eastern-Meets-California restaurant transcends the ordinary. It has a fanactically loyal clientele - myself not withstanding. It is constantly evolving and eclectic, serving up equal measures of food and decadent desserts. Anyone who wants to dine with me need to start here to experience the addicting, exotic flavors. Once, I took a friend here for a nice lunch for about 0 - she was quite surprised when I ordered another 0 worth of pastries to go. I told her it\'s my favorite bakery.
